intro: Trachyandra brehmeana, commonly known as the Brehme's trachyandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape province, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming structure with narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, pale green to white flowers that are clustered in spike-like inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
